conclusion: To determine whether the distance fallen during the 10 to 15 seconds interval is greater than 75 meters or less than 75 meters, we need to analyze the velocity-time graph provided.
The graph shows the velocity (v) of the skydiver as a function of time (t).
The graph starts at 20 m/s at t = 0.
The velocity decreases to 10 m/s at t = 10 seconds.
The velocity then increases to 20 m/s at t = 15 seconds.
The distance fallen can be calculated using the formula: Distance = Initial velocity × Time - (1/2) × Final velocity × Time^2.
Plugging in the values: Distance = 20 m/s × 5 s - (1/2) × 20 m/s × 5 s^2.
Since the calculated distance (50 meters) is less than 75 meters, the distance fallen during the 10 to 15 seconds interval is less than 75 meters.
